Reviews.Title: Great picture quality, except for off-angle viewing
Reviews.Author: peterfram
Reviews.Content: Note, this TV uses "direct lit" technology from Samsung. To reduce cost the EH6070/6000 models use fewer LEDs than traditional full array backlit or edge lit displays of the higher end slim models. And it is 120Hz, not 240Hz. 240Hz CMR is just a Samsung marketing label. That does not really matter though since 120Hz is pretty good.To my surprise and inconvenience it took me a few days to calibrate this screen. The options are limited but not too bad and certainly easy to work with. But I initially had a consistent problem fixing blown out yellows/limes/cheddar cheese colors. At first I was alarmed thinking that perhaps the new and cheaper direct lit technology sacrificed digital dynamic range. And I also had to deal with a seemingly old school 1990's overly red flesh tones problem. I tried multiple EH6000 calibration settings posted on avsforum and multiple review sites but was not satisfied. I was considering returning it.So I pulled out my Disney WOW calibration Blu Ray. It seemed like I hardly changed a thing, but somehow that calibration did the trick. Everything looks pretty close to perfect now. In the past I never spent more than 10 to 15 minutes calibrating a new TV or projector.Initial impressions are that our older Vizio SV472XVT has higher end components with full backlit array versus Samsung's new direct lit. However, despite something slightly inferior with the Samsung in overall screen micro-light management appearance, the Samsung beats the Vizio in depth of color rendition. The Vizio might win for watching standard TV dramas and news. But the Samsung wins clearly when watching high depth modern animation like Toy Story movies etc and video games.The direct lit technology uses fewer LEDs to reduce cost by quite a bit. There is a small price to quality which I can see but is hard to describe. Less micro management of light I guess. More like the first LCD's. When you bring up the all white screen on the Disney WOW calibration tools you can clearly see each section of LED lighting with grey gaps between each section and slight grey blotches in the upper left and right corners about 4 inches from the edges on the 55 inch model. I did not try this on the Visio, so nothing to compare this to. Whatever I see in difference is small enough that I don't really care however because the overall image produced on the screen during normal viewing is quite beautiful. I probably would never have noticed all this had the EH6070 been better calibrated out of the box.**May 2014 Update**Still going strong. Zero issues and pic quality appears better to me than most of the new edge lit slim models I see in Costco these days.**Original Review**That is my only beef with this TV. It took me 15 or 20 minutes here and there over a few days tweaking settings to get it to look right. Kind of an inconvenience.So in the interest of helping others, here are my hard earned current beloved EH6070 calibration settings.Backlight 19Contrast 100Brightness 44Sharpness 12Color 47Tint G51/R49AdvancedDynamic Contrast OffBlack Tone OffFlesh Tone -1RGB Only Mode OffColor Space AutoWhite Balance G-Gain 26, all others 25Gamma 0Motion Lighting OffPicture OptionsColor Tone StandardDigital Noise Filter OffMPEG Noise Filter OffLED Motion Plus OffBy the way, the reason I bought this model (and you might) over ES6500, ES7100 or other?:-No need for an edge lit slim TV since this is a corner installation in my family room. Also I can see the edge lit uniformity issues on the Costco showroom floor if I stand and stare long enough. The bleeding and torchlight problems with those higher end edge lit screens would not bug me very much, but I really do not feel the need to pay extra for it.-The EH6000/6070 TV has a mostly (but not a pure) matte screen. Plasmas and edge lit screens are almost entirely glossy to improve black levels. Glossy creates strong reflections. I can't watch anything when there is a light reflection on the screen. I just stare at the light and lose focus of what I am watching. We have kitchen lights in the distance behind one sofa and my wife likes to keep a light on around the sofa. The matte screen on this TV works very well at avoiding reflections. The black levels on the EH6070 are great. Black is seriously black. So don't worry about that.-3D for the kids! I had never before seen 3D on a TV. And while not a fan of 3D except for kids movies, I was impressed with Hugo and the Lorax. It's no more slightly distorted/weird than viewing in a movie theater. It is actually quite high quality and pretty cool in your home. Modern 3D is still for kids, or kids at heart. While I have nothing to compare to but movie theater 3D, this TV seems to do a good job with 3D. I also watched a quarter of NFL football in 2D to 3D conversion mode and it was kind of cool. You see the depth somewhat as if you were at the stadium so you can better tell the height and direction of movement of the players and the ball. But the you still have the slight weirdness of 3d and realistically you would want to watch your sports in 2D. For serious viewing I still classify 3D in the gimmick category. I would much rather watch a good non-kid's movie in 2D. The 3D glasses must go though. Glasses are annoying and inconvenient for making sandwiches in the kitchen and watching a movie at the same time!TV speakers & sound are fine. usually used by the kid. I use an attached AVR with surround speakers for most of my serious viewing though.

Reviews.Title: Great TV bundle with blue-ray
Reviews.Author: Sheng
Reviews.Content: = Summary =Pros:- Good starter bundle, has everything you need for a 3D smart TV, especially it gives you the blu-ray player- Great price for a Samsung TV- Amazing 3D effect- It makes XBOX games look fantastic- 3D glasses fit onto my glasses, so no worries if you wear glassesCons:- Web apps are slow- The remote controls for the TV and the player look very similar to each other- Only 2 pair of 3D glasses= Original post on July/2012 =This is a new model manufactured in May 2012, the price is decent, and this bundle has all the things you want:- Wifi support- Apps- Blu-ray- 3D- LEDThe only difference between this one and the more expensive ones is that the TV itself does not have wifi, but the blue-ray player does the magic of smart tv work. So if you are going to need the blue-ray anyway, this bundle is definitely a good deal.I have not got a chance to watch any 3D movie on it, but just playing XBOX games, it has been fantastic. The 55 screen looks awesome, so is the sound.= Sep/2012 update, after using for 2 months =I have been using the TV for about 2 months, majorly playing XBOX and watch Blu-ray movies, and it performs really well. I finally got a chance to watch the 3D movie Transformers, and it was amazing. One thing I like about the glass is that it fits onto my glasses too, so if you wear glasses, do not worry, the 3D glasses pair is very light and will fit. I hope it comes with more glasses though.The remote control's response is good, the only down side is that you will have two similar remote controls, one for the TV and the other one for the player. Sometimes I got confused with one from the other.I only used the apps inside the player once, and it was very slow. If I ever use it to watch streams, I would use XBOX rather than the player.

Reviews.Title: Great combo value for money
Reviews.Author: Anil Kumar
Reviews.Content: Pros:- Excellent picture quality- Plays 3D (blu ray discs as well as online services)- Reasonably decent 2D to 3D conversion on-the-fly- Plays movies from USB drive- Plays movies from DLNA "AllShare" over network- Unbelievable value for money- Stand is included- I was able to use Logitech corded mouse to control bluray player's browser, a huge relief!Cons:- TV is thick when viewed from the sides- TV has no wifi, but BluRay player has it- TV has no Apps, but BluRay player has them- BluRay player is fast to boot but sluggish to respond when changing menus etc- No way to plug in a keyboard or a mouse at present (future firmware update?)- It'd be great if the included BluRay player could fit in between the TV and the stand- No easy way to input text using wireless keyboard or remote app.

Reviews.Title: Awesome Deal and product..
Reviews.Author: Babloo
Reviews.Content: First, I was waiting to purchase a 47 Inches TV and home theater.. and I was dangling between 55 Vs 47 and 3D vs 2D.. found this bundle for 1397 in Tiger Direct.. I was looking for reviews but found sparing.. but they were good.. and since I found this a 2012 Model my eyebrows raised and felt its a good deal where you get all in one.. Though the TV itself does not have wifi, BD has it.. so good deal....On TV, it looked little bulky on the back, but the screen and the other looks cute.. Not like the one which are slim.. But when you are watching from the front you wont feel its minor bulge...or others..After I installed the TV and BD, I played a 3D movie and converted the 3D to 2D.. the Picture  Quality  of this TV is absolutely Stunning.. crystal clear both in 3D and 2D.. I was amazed and I was quite happy with the product.. Simple to install and go through.. I did not listen the sound on this TV as I purchased a Onkyo HT.On HDMI Inputs, am covered.. as my HT has 4 Inputs and 1 Out.. So I got 3 free slots.. I can plug any :-) .On the Blue Ray, It has got the apps that one needs.. HULU and NETFLIX covered my Cable cost.. and I watched the shows (HD) and movies they are cool.. and Brilliant. I was little disapponted on the BD as it did not had one of the APP which Samsung is shipping with all its models (It does not come with Yupp TV).. I wish Samsung gets the Crackle app and the listed app to this BD model too..The TV has sensitive eye.. it adjusts the brightness as per the room and lighting that you have.. when .. No need to calibrate.. (and I did not calibrate) any of the default setting .If people are looking for 3D+ BD+ 55inch. TV like me in low cost.. this is it... no more looking back.. If someone wants a slim version of the TV with all in one TV, then you need to give a think.So, Its definitely a worthy product to go..

Reviews.Title: Flimsy stand, but otherwise great!
Reviews.Author: Foboz
Reviews.Content: First off, this is a "240Hz" HDTV like is says in the "Samsung LED TV Comparison Chart"; not "120Hz" like it says in the description.Second, compared to my old 51" 1080i rear-projector the picture is simply amazing!  Can't wait to watch the Patriots games on this bad boy!The bundled Blu-ray gets the job done and makes up for the lack of smarts in the TV nicely (how many smart devices does one need anyways?).  It had no problems connecting to my home NAS via 802.11g and streamed music, ripped DVDs, and Netflix just fine (I don't have a Blu-ray in my computer so I can only rip standard DVDs).  However, when doing anything other than just playing discs, the Blu-ray player does tend to get a little hot.The menus on both the TV and Blue-ray are pretty straight forward (be sure to adjust the picture settings to your liking); I thought the TV produced pretty good sound for a TV.  I was skeptical of the 3D effects, but after watching "Despicable Me" in 3D with the wife and kids I must say I was impressed - it's as good as what you'll see in the theater.Couple of minor minuses that prevent it from getting five stars: one, the stand is very flimsy and two, even though the glasses are inexpensive I think it should have come with four pairs instead of two.

Reviews.Title: Great purchase and great picture!
Reviews.Author: Taterbug "Tbug"
Reviews.Content: Not going into a technical review because there are many about this model that are well written. It's true it has a great picture and obviously the Blue Ray player with the Smart Apps make this a nice deal. The 3D part is cool but actually it's interesting for the first few days then I lost some interest. Still a nice feature.  The negatives are few but I will try and tell you what others missed.  The TV stand does NOT swivel.  It also does not have any audio outputs other than a digital audio out.  (I have a slight hearing problem and have a Sennheiser wireless headphone set that I used sometimes when watching so I could hear better. Also helped at night when you were in bed and didn't want to disturb the wife.)  Anyway, I can't connect it because of lack of the RCA audio outputs on this model. My older 32" Samsung had that feature.  Not a big deal for most.  Also this has only 2 HDMI's which it does state but seriously they need to make 3 standard. On higher models usually you get that feature plus others so take that into consideration. You get what you pay for in any TV so all in all most people will love this combo and price. Great quality picture and descent price. I've only had this for a week so should I encounter any issues I will let everyone know.

Reviews.Title: A great deal and a nice package.
Reviews.Author: JB "Jim"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this TV/DVD/3D glasses combo as a "Warehouse deal". It arrived on time in the factory box looking like new, with a slight ding in one side of the box and a DVD movie inside the DVD, but it was a good one! This TV/flat panel is like a window when mounted on the wall(which I did easily with a mount from Amazon). The clarity and sharpness is amazing. The sound is also quite good for a flat panel probably due to the deeper back which wasn't a problem on wall installation. The DVD integration for smart TV features is excellent and I had no problem linking it to my router in my Den(2 rooms away). The glasses seem cheap but that's the latest style from what I can see and they work well. Overall I couldn't be happier with the package and the price couldn't be beat!

Reviews.Title: Great TV for the price
Reviews.Author: James Shaw
Reviews.Content: Bought the TV a few weeks ago. Watched 3D movie once and it is fantastic. For 3D, you better get TV over 55'' to see the effect. You can also get additional 3D glasses for around $17 from Amazon. The only drawback of this TV is the limited inputs it can accept, just 2 HDMI and 1 other options. This is not a problem if you have a receiver.

Reviews.Title: good tv, great for brighter rooms
Reviews.Author: Goodies
Reviews.Content: Overall.. I got an amazing deal for a really good tv.I have a bright room and my older 42 toshiba was too reflective making tv watching difficult.This tv's matte screen is much better for the most part. Bright lights can give a slight rainbow affect but I'm pretty happy.Blacks do get crushed on this, being lcd, but as plasma is not available with a matte screen I'll settle (in fact few LCDs come this way either).I use this mainly for my XBMC htpc, it works nicely for that. My old tv would never turn itself off (if I accidently left it on, or even if the HTPC went into sleep) but this one does which is great. Hate coming home to a tv that's been sitting powered on all day.Sadly, no PAL support (25/50hz refresh rates) for you british tv watchers. I think only some Sony's are confirmed to support that currently on this side of atlantic.Motion seems really good, I don't see a lot of ghosting - 24hz movies look near flawless except for the dark scenes (but still on par with most other lcd on that front).Backlighting seems really even, much better than most more expensive edge lit LCDs. Yeah this tv is thicker but i'll take that for more uniform lighting to avoid that 'dirty screen' look.Haven't noticed any backlight bleeding or flashing.3D - hadn't planned to use this (I was originally lookign for a samsung eh6000 which doesn't come with the glasses or bluray player) but the price was really good on this set. The 3D is good! I haven't actually watched a 3d movie in many years but I'll admit this is a nice plus. It did take me 2 weeks to figure out the reason the glasses didn't work was because I had the batteries in backwards.. Maybe i'm dumb but the cr2016's fit both ways - thought it was xbmc's fault.Bluray player - Didn't have a need for this, but I actually use it quite a bit with my older toshiba. The player can use DLNA sources for video playback (and has wifi) so my htpc can server up movies through plex media server. Plex client should be coming eventually through samsung smarthub as well.

Reviews.Title: The tv is GREAT the dvd player is ok
Reviews.Author: paw
Reviews.Content: I really like my new tv the 3d quality is so vibrant and was a great buy. The DVD player is also good but have it in an open area to get air cause it will over heat!

Reviews.Title: My review
Reviews.Author: humanbeeng
Reviews.Content: I am very satisfied with all 3 products included in the package...T.V.  DVD player and 3d glasses..I just watched my 1st 3d dvd movie (Hugo) and the picture quality was great...The nice thing is, you get everything you need to get started for 3d viewing...Don't forget to order the HDMI cords..make sure you order the right lenghs

Reviews.Title: 3D at last,at last
Reviews.Author: lesandliz
Reviews.Content: I finally have my own 3D TV and it is every thing they said it was. We have enjoyed the big screen especially while watching the 3D movies. The picture quality is outstanding, the speakers are a little weak, but a surround sound system will take care of that.Great Buy!!!

Reviews.Title: Great bang for the buck...but...
Reviews.Author: j2dak
Reviews.Content: I'm not going to say this 3D TV/3D player/3D glasses bundle isn't great but I have a few issues right out of the box.1. how about some output options, I wanted to hook up a sound bar so imagine my disappointment when I discovered it didn't have any audio outs except for the digital audio jack. The sound bar came with the red/white, I don't think it even had a digital audio input. So a little bummed about that. Same thing with the 3D player, just a digital audio out...Digital Audio Cable via amazon...about $6.2. Only 2 HDMI hookups...Okay it says that on the box but in this modern age of HD everything, at least one more HDMI would've been nice.HDMI splitter switch via amazon...about $10.I bought it last night and haven't had a chance to watch a 3D movie on it yet but I did use the 2D to 3D conversion to watch regular TV and it seemed pretty good.I'm not really complaining, for the price the TV and accessories are pretty good and for less then 20 bucks I can bring this TV bundle up to the level I want it at but I may have to return my sound bar and find one with a few more input options. I just wanted to give any future buyers the heads up.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: HHOCO
Reviews.Content: For the same price as a non 3D TV plus DVD player, I bought this TV that came with a 3D Blu-Ray play, and basically free 3D option

Reviews.Title: Its good but go blank for a moment every now and then
Reviews.Author: mOHAMMAD Aziz
Reviews.Content: I like Samsung TV very much. I bought Samsung TV befre this one and another one after this one. All of them gives very good quality picture that can be matched only by Sony Bravia. The resolution is not as high as I would like for its size, but its good enough because there is few content available which has higher resolution. 3D quality is also good compare to other 3-D tv but do not expect anything like IMAX theater.Although I would have pleased with the tv very much one thing that is very annoying is every now and then it goes blank and then the picture comes back. It stays blank for less than a second and does not happen that often and doesnot affect the viewing flow but it is very annoying and from Samsung I did not expect that.

Reviews.Title: Great BUNDLE!!
Reviews.Author: applecinnamon06
Reviews.Content: I just love it!! I'm so glad I bought it. I had my eye on this bundle for quite a while now and when they threw it on sale, I bought it. It was a good deal. I love my tv, the blu ray. the glasses. Netflix looks great, regular tv or a dvd. The sound is great and it look priceless in my room:) I deff will recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Great television
Reviews.Author: Annette Exalus "Exalus"
Reviews.Content: This television works great.  It easy to function and manage.  I love this the whole set and it a grat price.  I will recommend the seller to anyone.

Reviews.Title: Great TV at a great price!
Reviews.Author: Chazeray Delarosa "Moaltar"
Reviews.Content: I got this TV to replace an old rear projection 720p TV, so I think even the crappiest of new led TVs would be a step up! Either way I'm very happy with the TV. I've had it for a few months now with no complaints. The screen is bright and after calibrating (using the commenter settings below) the colors and overall picture look great. There can be a little bit of glare on the display if it is facing a window, but its not too bad. Also like other commenters have said, it is a 120hz TV not  240hz. The bluray player that came with it is usable, but not nearly as good as a ps3, which is as to be expected, so no real complaint there. The 3d looks great and I'm very impressed with how well it works. Play black ops 2 zombies on it in 3d, it will add another layer of fright to it! It comes with just 2 glasses but you can buy another set for less than $40 here on amazon, and they work great.I cant speak on reliability yet,but so far so good! Im happy when any electronic appliance last more than 3 years, so if it last at least that long I will be happy!also, the amazon guys that delivered it and set it up was very good. they made sure it wasnt damaged in transit and that it turned on without issue.great TV at a great price ($717 with tax and shipping). keep up the good work samsung (and amazon).

Reviews.Title: Great deal for the price
Reviews.Author: Michael J. Nicholl
Reviews.Content: The tv has great color with our Direct Tv hook ups.Also the blue ray has great definition for the grand children's blu-ray dvds.

Reviews.Title: I'm sticking with Samsung
Reviews.Author: Frank Leone
Reviews.Content: This is my third Samsung TV. I really didn't think 3D  was ready for prime time... until I got this TV. I have to say, I'm impressed.The only issue I have is setting up the TV to my network and the Blue Ray player. I guess I'll just have to read the instructions.I have recently found an issue with the auto dimming feature, the screen brightness seems to randomly change even though the room lighting has not changed. Sometimes the display is too dark. I will be calling Samsung customer service for this issue.UPDATE: maybe it was me, the dimming issue seems to have cured itself. I now give it 5 stars.

Reviews.Title: This TV is a good model but read my comments
Reviews.Author: BO
Reviews.Content: The set is perfectly adequate and a reasonable model for the price but, after purchasing it, I found the picture to not be as clear as other similar models I had seen. I finally got a high definition box from my cable provider and that seemed to help. I would do further research on my next big screen TV as I suspect other Samsung models may be better. I will say, I like Samsung as a brand and would recommend it. Consumer's Reports gives the brand a good to "midling" rating in its July 2013 issue for "Big TV's".

Reviews.Title: Picture is very good as expected from Samsung !!!
Reviews.Author: Eswara K Vemuri "Amazon Shopper"
Reviews.Content: Love the TV..Excellent picture and has lot of apps to choose from. Samsung smart hub is very good and has tons of apps to choose from.

Reviews.Title: Enjoyable
Reviews.Author: s. stewart
Reviews.Content: Tried the 3d once. Better than most, but I really don't own any 3d stuff. Blue Ray player is a little misleading on offered products. There are many apps you have to purchase. Since it's the Samsung interface, I'm assuming that's true of all of their products. Still, the software, while still slow, operates faster than the smart TVs with the software built in. The TV performs admirably. I don't notice the difference among this TV and TVs with a higher refresh. Someone who's really into TVs may care. Still, I'm happy for what I paid.

Reviews.Title: Awesome Picture!
Reviews.Author: H. Baer
Reviews.Content: This is a terrific television. The picture is fantastic, self-adjusting to the level of light in the room. The screen isn't nearly as reflective as others. Even the sound isn't terrible, especially for a flat screen tv. I hooked it up to a sony sound box with a subwoofer, and it's terrific, nearly surround sound. Altogether, I recommend this tv highly!

Reviews.Title: Great TV for a pretty decent price.
Reviews.Author: Nobody Special
Reviews.Content: I really wasn't looking for a new TV as I already had a 32" Samsung LCD TV which was working great.  However, when I saw a deal they had going for this Samsung EH6070 3D TV, I just couldn't pass up the offer.  It is much bigger than my original TV and 3D on it is excellent.  The fact that it also comes with a free 3D blu-ray player and two 3D glasses also made it a worthy buy.  As for the picture and sound quality of this TV, like any other Samsung TV, it has very good if not excellent picture plus the onboard speakers do delivery clear sound.  The only negative thing I can think of is that it only has 2 HDMI ports, but I found a HDMI switch that works pretty good and purchased it the same time I got my TV.  I've got a PS3, Xbox 360, Wii U, and PC hooked up to this TV set where each item looks visually stunning, but some picture settings will need to be adjusted to delivery the best quality.  Finally, I don't pay for cable, so I get my TV programming with over-the-air broadcasting and the HD channels look great, espeically on this TV.  Recommended buy if you are in the market for a new TV that supports 3D as it comes with everything you need right out of the box.Negative:Only 2 HDMI portsNo HDMI cable with blu-ray player provided (not surprising though)Positive:Great picture and sound qualityFree 3D blu-ray playerTwo pairs of 3D glasses included and additional glasses are reasonably priced.

Reviews.Title: This is a good TV!
Reviews.Author: AquariangirlDC
Reviews.Content: I've rated this a 4 instead of 5 only because it is a little bulky compared to all the razor thin tv's that are out now, but I have it sitting on some huge speakers with the back to the wall so it really doesn't matter too much about the bulk.  I bought this off of Amazon used and boy I tell ya, you can't even tell it's "used".  It may of been something a buyer had remorse about.  This tv has a great picture without any of the backlighting from another "brand" I recently bought and had to return because of all the bleeding.  Also, the Blu Ray player is definitely an added plus making this combo pack so much more affordable that other big screen tvs.  Samsung is just a good product - period.  :-)

Reviews.Title: Samsung UN55EH6070 55-Inch 1080p 120Hz LED 3D HDTV with 3D Blu-ray...
Reviews.Author: David W. Scott
Reviews.Content: I recently had back surgery in September so it was perfect to help the time go by being able to watch movies and TV in high definition as well as 3D.

Reviews.Title: Awesome TV
Reviews.Author: Courtdude
Reviews.Content: After buying Sony almost exclusively for years we decided to give the Samsung a try. We are very happy with the television and would recommend to anyone. Delivery and installation was also excellent. This was our first television purchase form Amazon so we were a little skeptical but I would not hesitate to order again.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Quality and awesome delivery service!!!!
Reviews.Author: doc
Reviews.Content: Was looking to buy a new big screen TV for my new apartment, saw this through SlickDeals.com that they offered this bundle for $998 free shipping! Pulled the trigger an was not disappointed. I think the whole 3D concept still has some growing to do but I also haven't actually watched/played something that was full 100% 3D. I want to go buy a 3D bluray I just haven't had the time!

Reviews.Title: not bad
Reviews.Author: Mr Barter
Reviews.Content: I have to start by saying I love samsung. My selection was between the lg 7600 and this tv, the 6070. The lg 7600 was on sale but I missed it, so I got the Samsung and the bluray player bundle. I have a samsung lnt4669 and that has the most incredible picture I have ever seen.  This tv was $1000 less and the picture is clear but not as good as my other tv, but still an upgrade over my Sony that died that was 10the years old.  The 3d so far is ok but there really isn't that many programs to watch. I have yet to watch 2d unconverted to three d.Set came with 3 internal smudges that Samsung customer service had someone come out to replace the panel. Samsung customer service is the best.  So with that being said the set is an upgrade so I am happy and the bluray player I needed anyway. I would give it a 4get based on the picture alone not on the panel I needed to get.I hope this helps

Reviews.Title: Look elsewhere
Reviews.Author: jasond
Reviews.Content: The first unit I received had a shattered screen and was exchanged happily by Amazon for a full refund.  I then went to Best Buy and purchased a replacement unit the same day, which worked for 5 months until the unit started restarting itself continuously, with the HDMI having a hard time keeping a lock on the signal... at first.  Eventually, even with all HDMI devices disconnected from the unit, it now continuously restarts itself every few seconds after it's been running for about 30 minutes.  This seems like it's a problem related to bad connections which are becoming unreliable when the unit heats up.While the unit worked, I had the same issues with getting a good picture as the other reviewers here - I've never messed around with a display this much in my life.  I had to carefully use the settings provided by other reviewers to get something that was "just OK", which on previous Samsung TV's just worked out of the box. I was never in love with the display though, as my previous Samsung displays were much better.  You need to disable almost all of the automatic features in order to get the display to not act up, which has been observed by many other reviewers here.  It's just a finicky set of TV's.With regards the "12 month Warranty" they advertise: Best Buy is refusing to let me return the defective product (they only honor manufacturer's warrantes in the first 15 days) and Samsung insists I have to ship the unit to Melbourne, FL at my own expense since my unit is more than 30 days old ($112.50 each way shipping costs). If something goes wrong, as did with two units - you are on your own.This is my third Samsung LED/LCD TV that I've owned, so I have a lot of experience with Samsung products.  My observation is that unit 1 (an LCD model) was made of solid glass and had a fantastic picture out of the box.  Unit 2 also had good build quality (an LED), but it felt cheaper and more flimsy than unit 1.  Unit 3, the defective unit, feels like a very cheap piece of plastic, and the screen isn't even glass (since I received a shattered one the first time, I got to see what it's really made of).  You get what you pay for, and this is a cheap TV for the size.I would not recommend Samsung TV products in this price range until they improve their build quality and stand behind their warranty.I will not shop at Best Buy again - Amazon is a MUCH safer bet if you have problems.

Reviews.Title: Super TV on affordable Rates
Reviews.Author: Jean Paul
Reviews.Content: Like this - good value for money.Like YouTube, NetFlix, Vudu - best enough for home entertainment (you should have faster internet connection too)I prefer the applications to be faster in future.

Reviews.Title: CHANGE THE PRODUCT PHOTO!!!!
Reviews.Author: Amazon customer
Reviews.Content: The picture shows the TV has smart hub, it doesn't! The Blu-Ray player provides the Smart TV and is painfully slow to use. The TV has great picture and the 3D is a nice feature, but to depict it as a Smart TV is misleading.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: prasanna
Reviews.Content: The TV is very good... Very crisp and sharp images. The DVD player is very slow. i really do not care about the DVD player as i already have a SONY HOME theatre entertainment system.TV works great with my SONY BD player. Reviews.Title: BAD audio problem
Reviews.Author: CD_in_NM
Reviews.Content: UN46EH6070 TV.  Picture was great, 3D performance was good.  BAD audio sync problem.  I have a receiver that I run all of my gear through and it connects to a single HDMI input on the TV.  When I hooked up the set, anything that was routed through the HDMI input had the audio problem.  My previous TV was also a Samsung and did not have the problem, so that pointed to the new set.Initially, the audio would drift in and out of sync with the video.  At best, the audio was perfectly in sync, at worst it would lead the video by as much as three words.  Started poking around the web and found that the audio problem was a known issue with the EH6XXX series of TVs.  Found one post that said Samsung had released new firmware that fixed the problem.  My set did not have the latest firmware, so I installed it.  It did not fix the problem, just changed it.Now instead of audio leading the video, it lagged the video.  As before, it would drift in and out of sync, sometimes lagging by about 1 1/2 words.  There is a setting in the "hidden" control pages for changing audio delay, but that was not of any help either.  The setting adds/subtracts a fixed amount of delay to the audio, but the problem is not a constant delay, it drifts.Wrote Samsung support an email.  Their reply was very polite, but essentially they told me that if I had the latest firmware loaded that I was out of luck - maybe if I took it in for service, the shop might be able to do something about it.  Totally unacceptable for a piece of gear that costs that much.  The TV was returned and Samsung loses my business.  I will give an LG TV a try.  Will post about the LG after I have lived with it for a while.Update - April 1So, took a long time to get back to this.  Tried an LG (do not remember which one) and personally thought that their 3D was not as good as Samsung, although the LG passive glasses were easier to wear.  The LG went back after a couple of days.  I ended up getting one of the Samsung EH6000 series.  No 3D, I guess I am just not that impressed with 3D in general.  No smart features, I already have a Roku streamer that I am happy with and did not see any reason to spend extra money on a smart TV with features that esentially duplicated the Roku.  Very happy with the picture quality and features of the EH6000 TV, it is a good TV.  As far as the audio sync problem, I finally gave up on that.  The Samsung EH6070 and the LG that I tried both had severe sync problems.  The EH6000 that I have now occasionally has problems as well, although it does not seem as bad.  It seems to pretty much take care of the problem if the TV is turned on last.  Maybe something to do with HDMI handshaking.  Even doing that, the sync problem happens once in a while.  Guess I will just live with it.  I am tired of swapping TV sets, when it seems that they probably all have the problem to some degree.

Reviews.Title: Disappointing
Reviews.Author: Mike
Reviews.Content: I bought this product approximately 3 weeks ago.  At the time of writing this the power supply has quit working.  If you are looking for a smart tv, look elsewhere.  All of the "smarts" are built into the blu-ray player which is PAINFULLY slow.  Samsung must have cheeped out big time on the wireless card in this thing.  Also there is NO Amazon app for the blu-ray player, even though Amazon has an app for Samsung smart tvs.  From what I can tell Amazon has been ignoring customer requests for this for over 3 years.  2 stars for Samsung on this one, and 2 stars for Amazon.  Disappointed with this expensive purchase.

Reviews.Title: Piece of JUNK!!!!
Reviews.Author: Robert J. Thomas
Reviews.Content: Received first TV with the screen shattered.  Returned item for a replacement.  I received the replacement TV and everything seemed to be fine at first.  The TV originally had a bright vibrant picture.  It now gradually goes from being a bright and vibrant picture when you start viewing a program to a very dim and dull picture in a matter of seconds.  The picture becomes very dark and unable to view.  It also constantly changes from one size setting to another.  During the changes you are not able to view or hear anything that is going on.  What a pain.  This TV is a real piece of JUNK!!!!!  Of course when the problem finally shows itself, the return date has come and gone.  I will be contacting Amazon.com about this and hopefully they will send me another replacement.  **BUYER BEWARE**  I do realize that I may have gotten a lemon, but can't help providing a bad review for the piece of junk I received.
